intro: Uncinia douglasii, commonly known as the Douglas's hookweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
